revised_title: Temperature and Time Effects on Photo-Elastic Constants of Glass
tldr: This study investigates the effects of high temperatures and time on the photo-elastic constants of glass. The stress-optical coefficients of various glass samples were measured at different temperatures and over extended periods. The results show that the stress-optical coefficient generally increases with rising temperature and that it also increases with the lapse of time. The findings suggest that the value of the stress-optical coefficient increases rapidly during the first few years after casting the glass and then stabilizes.
